node.title: Tasmania to lift dancing, stand-up drinking caps in early December
node.description: The days of camp chairs at music festivals in Tasmania are numbered, with both indoor and outdoor dancing and stand-up drinking caps being lifted early next month.
node.content:
["Restrictions on dancing and drinking at events, pubs and clubs will lift on December 6 in Tasmania for venues where all patrons are fully vaccinated, Premier Peter Gutwein has announced.", "Currently, dancing and drinking alcohol\u00a0is permitted in premises with a liquor licence or\u00a0liquor permit up to a maximum of 100 people in indoor spaces and 250 people in outdoor spaces.", "Crowds have had to sit down at outdoor music festivals in the state, with organisers of the New Year's Hobart Summer event cancelling the event last week, partly\u00a0due to the dancing limits.", "All staff at venues with crowds dancing and stand-up drinking will also have to be fully vaccinated by December 15, when the state's border restrictions with COVID hotspots ease.", "\"This means that if you're at an event from December 6 with the approved limit of 5,000 people, 5,000\u00a0people will be able to stand up and drink or dance, as long as every patron is fully vaccinated,\" he said.", "\"And if that event is passed\u00a0December 15, staff will need to be vaccinated as well.\"", "
Vaccination rates waning
", "Mr Gutwein said Tasmania's vaccination rate was slowing down, and that he was particularly worried about the lack of uptake in younger age groups.", "\"The 12\u00a0to 15-year age group is still lagging behind. That's at only 68 per cent first dose. Roughly half of that group have had both injections at this stage,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"At our current\u00a0rate we will barely get to 90 per cent of the population over the age of 12 by the 15th of December.\u00a0", "The Premier said there would be a five-day vaccination blitz for those aged 12 to 15 years old, starting\u00a0tomorrow.", "\"If you're aged 12-18 and had one\u00a0or two\u00a0doses, you're in a draw to win an iPad, iPhone or Apple Watch,\" Mr Gutwein said.\u00a0", "\"Where I don't want to be on December 16 is looking back and saying: 'Gee, I wish that we'd done a little bit more or provided some incentives.'\"", "He said there would be 50 prizes up for grabs to encourage young people to get the jab.\u00a0", "More to come."]
